result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie George Maclin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie George Maclin appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Willie George Maclin.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Willie George Maclin not in court, defendant in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense counsel in trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with J.M.L, C.M.S. and Pick N Save 2355 N. 35th Street
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie George Maclin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Willie George Maclin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
